sub_title: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors
summary:
A hard working and ambitious individual with strong analytical skills and a continuous tendency to expand his cognitive horizons. My way of work is noted for being well-structured and efficient, with emphasis on teamwork and communication.

My current fields of interest are (but not limited to) Infrastructure Projects, Energy Transition Projects, Project Planning and Management and Process Management (with emphasis to optimization).

projects.title: BIM Model of the St. Sebastiaansbrug (Delft, Netherlands)
projects.description:
Creation of BIM Model for a new concept design of the St. Sebastiaansbrug bridge, including:

• Render creation using Autodesk Revit 
• Clash detection using Tekla BIMsight and Autodesk Navisworks
• Project planning using MS Project
• Generation of 4D simulation of the project using Autodesk Navisworks

Completed for the course CIE4120 Information Systems for the Construction industry, TU Delft.

contributors.headline: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors

projects.title: Oosterschelde storm surge barrier
projects.description:
Multidisciplinary group project with emphasis on soft skills, peer pressure and group dynamics. Roles, tasks and focal points will have to be distributed within the team upon responsibility of its own members. The aim of the assignment focuses on providing to the hypothetical client a long-term strategy aimed at safety and economic viability of the wider region of Oosterschelde, including alterations on the storm surge barrier. Relevant stakeholders’ interests is crucial and policy making is based on the scenario of a 200cm sea level rise in 2100. Two group reports were submitted in two phases:

• Phase I report: Collection of information and broad analysis of the Oosterschelde water system, the Oosterschelde barrier, the current strategy and the interests of the stakeholders involved

• Phase II report: Synthesis and design of sustainable alternative solutions, using the tool of Multicriteria Analysis (MCA).

Key project characteristics:
• Focus on soft skills, intragroup roles
• Large multidisciplinary group (30 members)
• Complex problem analysis
• Peer pressure, groups dynamics
• Weekly-based Consultation & Project Meetings

Completed for the course CME1200 Collaborative Design and Engineering.

contributors.headline: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors

projects.title: HSL-South East, fictitious high speed rail project (Breda-Venlo)
projects.description:
The fictitious project HSL-South East regards a high speed rail project between the cities of Breda and Venlo, the Netherlands. The deliverables required for the project include:

• Optimization of Project Planning (Gantt charts, Network diagrams, Cost & Duration estimation)
• Risk Matrix (Consequences, Risk probability, Impact, Response)
• Contracting (Organisational Breakdown Structure, Contract Quilt)
• Project Monitoring and Change Management ( CPI, SPI, Lead & Lag Indicators)

Completed for the course SPM8000 Project Management, TU Delft.

contributors.headline: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors

projects.title: Procurement process design of Rotterdamsebaan case
projects.description:
The municipality of The Hague wants to improve the accessibility of the city. The Rotterdamsebaan is the new road between junction Ypenburg (A4 / A13) and the center ring of The Hague. For the purposes of this individual assignment, the design of the respective procurement process is requested, including:

• Assessment of public values
• Project delivery model (Design, Build & Maintain)
• Contractual arrangements
• Tender procedure and Award criteria

Completed for the course CME5000 Procurement of Large Infrastructural Projects, TU Delft.

contributors.headline: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors

projects.title: Case Stadshagen – Maasdam
projects.description:
A group assignment regarding the development of a new city district for the fictional city of Maasdam. The municipality of Maasdam wants to develop a new city district to accommodate further growth of the city for approximately thirty years. The group assumes the role of the municipality, in the form of a process manager who acts on behalf of the Bench of Mayor and Aldermen, providing the following deliverables:

• Network & Stakeholder analysis, including their interdependencies 
• SWOT Analysis
• Process design (Formulation of process dilemmas and rounds) 
• Stakeholder engagement plan

Completed for the course SPM8002 Process Management, TU Delft.

contributors.headline: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors

projects.title: Life Cycle Costing Analysis for Hansweert Locks
projects.description:
Hansweert Locks are operated and maintained by Rijkswaterstaat,comprising an important link in a major shipping corridor between Rotterdam and Vlissingen, Terneuzen and Ghent (Belgium). Maintaining these locks is a crucial task for the regional department Zee & Delta of Rijkswaterstaat. This department needs advice on assuring the level of availability and maintainability of the navigation locks and its operating mechanism. For the purposes of this group assignment, a report was conducted to provide consultation regarding the benefits from the implementation of a life cycle costing strategy in maintenance in comparison to preserving the current maintenance strategy.

Tools used: Life Cycle Costing Analysis (LCCA), Failure Mode, Effects and Criticality Analysis (FMECA)

Completed for the course CME1210-14 Infrastructure Asset Management, TU Delft.

contributors.headline: Jr Removal Engineer at Heerema Marine Contractors

profile_positions.description:
• Drawing the site layouts of various PV plant projects across Greece and Europe, which display all the steel parts of the support structure.
• Compiling bills of materials (BOMs), based on the aforementioned drawings, which are the basis for the commencement of the production.
• Creating and archiving all the necessary quality control documents, related with the production and delivery of items, intended for PV plants across Greece and England.
• Ensuring the company and its procedures comply with the requirements set out by the ISO9001:2015 and ISO14001:2015 standards. Also, representing the company in its annual inspections.
• Creating production orders for the production of metal panels, intended for the false ceiling and walls of newly-built metro stations.
• Assisting the ongoing effort to transition to a new ERP system, by "dissecting" the current procedures and documents used in day-to-day operations, in order to fit with the new software.
profile_positions.title: Engineer

profile_positions.description: Conducted an explorative study on the added value generated by urban open spaces on surrounding real estate. A hedonic pricing model was created to spatially correlate recorded real estate transactions with proximity to green and blue spaces within Delft.
profile_positions.title: Graduation Internship

profile_positions.description:
Supervision of renovation works inside the Greek Ministry of National Defence.
Supervision of the reconstruction of one hundred and fifty (150) containers for usage in refugee camps.
Creation of an analytical topographic map of the officers' new residential area with surveying instruments.
profile_positions.title: Junior Civil Engineer

Contributed to the construction site management of a power plant, by keeping track of needed materials and labour through Autocad drawings and interactive excel files.
